title: What are some songs that cheer you up? - Quora

response.answer_text: You ask: "What are some songs that can cheer anyone up?" I like Long Nguyen's answer: Don't Worry, Be Happy - Bobby McFerrinThe Lion King - Hakuna MatataSomewhere Over the Rainbow - ?What a Wonderful World - ?All You Need Is Love - The BeatlesOne Love - Bob Marley & The Wailers And I would like to add to it: Feeling Good - Nina SimoneI Wish I know How It Would Feel T Be Free - Nina SimoneBrown Eyed Girl  - Van MorrisonThe Wight - The BandJames Brown - I Feel GoodThe Beach Boys - Good VibrationsMy Happiness - Connie FrancisHappy Days, Pratt & McClain with Brother LoveIf It Makes You Happy, Sheryl CrowShiny Happy People, R.E.M.Happy, PharrellJason Mraz - I'm YoursHarry Belafonte - Jump in the LineThe Kingsmen - Louie LouieThe Knack - My SharonaLittle Richard - Tutti FruttiThird Eye Blind - Semi-Charmed LifeNorman Greenbaum - Spirit In The SkyMichael Jackson - The way you make me feelDaft Punk - Get LuckyKatrina & The Waves - Walking On SunshineThe Foundations - Build Me Up ButtercupThe Monkees - I'm A BelieverWham! - Wake Me up Before You Go-GoJackson 5 - ABCChumbawamba - TubthumpingSimon & Garfunkel - CeciliaABBA - Dancing Queen (most ABBA)Boney M - Daddy Cool (most Boney M)

“MMMBop” -Hanson …Nuff said… … But, I’m gonna say more anyway! :-) I was 20 years old when this song came out back in 1997, and most people I know now still hate this “earworm” of a song with a fiery passion. :-( “No…” - they say, when I DJ at parties… ”Stop!” “Dear God, my ears are bleeding!“ “Please play something… anything else!” -they say… “I’d rather hear Baby Shark for the 9 millionth time!” -they scream, from my passenger seat. “Take it off your playlist, burn it to a CD, and kill it with fire!” -they say. :-( Maybe it was over-played, maybe people just got sick of hearing it, or maybe it just wasn’t their ”thing”. All I know is that, as a 40 something “grown-ass-man”, I have never been ashamed to say that every now and then, I need a little “MMMBop” in my life! :-) I’m not sure exactly why, but this song always makes me smile, and it never fails to get me out of whatever “funk” I’m in! :-) I think it might have something to do with being rebellious…. The act of being unapologetic about loving something that everyone else hates, knowing that only YOU control the volume…. BBWWAAAHAAHAAHAA! :-) It’s also just a happy, upbeat, catchy tune! :-) On a lighter note, I do have a theory! :-) I think a lot of people are still a little “butt-hurt” because they were attracted to Taylor Hanson in the music video back in 1997…. Until they found out “she” was a 13 year-old DUDE!… Oops! :-( Why don’t you try “MMMBop-ing” someone your own age, ya freak! :-( Maybe THAT is why they hate the song so much! :-( But I’m not bitter…. I’m not bitter at all… and even if I was, I can just play “MMMBop” and forget about all the “haters”! :-) All joking aside, whatever your reason for hating this song…. Or, even if you loved the song back then, and just haven’t heard it in a while… Maybe it’s time to give “MMMBop“ another chance! :-)
